column4: UGH! ubuntu booted me from sudoers when I tried setting a root password!
you don't want to set a root password
I wouldn't have needed it if this stupid policykit window didn't replace my kdesu one and keep asking for a root instead of sudo password
erm maybe it ws kdesudo not kdesu lol
my heads still back in edgy and feisty days sometimes :)
never used kubuntu at least for more then about 5 minutes.
with a quick google og the policykit and kde I do see some bugs
doesn't matter, kdesudo (formerly kdesu but broke  with parallel kde3 and kde4 so kdesudo was made as a fix or something) anyway so kdesudo is just the kde version of gksu right? ...
not sure I have not used it enough to know the commands
yes but you do know gksu right?
some what I use gksudo mainly
oh ok gnome has a gksudo now too? I see.. ok well that one then ...either is fine!
not real familiar with the differences really yeah.
none of this helps me get my password back! ...
hmm, I will say that we are probably way beyond my skill set, I have some specialty areas mainly I'm just a user really.
